THE DAY AFTER the review, Boris, in his best uniform and with his comrade Berg's best wishes for success, rode to Olmiitz to see Bol- konski, wishing to profit by his friendliness and obtain for himself the best post he could pref- erably that of adjutant to some important personage, a position in the army which seemed to him most attractive.
